definition: half/semi-/incomplete/(after a number) and a half

point/dot/drop/speck/o'clock/point (in space or time)/to draw a dot/to check on a list/to choose/to order (food in a restaurant)/to touch briefly/to hint/to light/to ignite/to pour a liquid drop by drop/(old) one fifth of a two-hour watch 更[geng1]/dot stroke in Chinese characters/classifier for items
just the tiniest bit/a hint of

sentences.english: We must emphasize basic management pragmatic, no sophistry is allowed and rash.
sentences.chinese: 抓基础管理一定要强调务实，来不得半点虚假和浮躁。

sentences.english: He is such a high-level miser that no one can gain anything from him.
sentences.chinese: 他是一个极顶吝啬的人，谁也别想占他半点便宜。

sentences.english: I told them they were going to lose that bet because I don't have any intentions of crying.
sentences.chinese: 我告诉他们会赌输，因为我根本没有半点要哭的打算。

sentences.english: May the slightest residue of white, ape calls out alone.
sentences.chinese: 梅残半点白，猿叫一声孤。

sentences.english: When you give up something for something that does not bring immediate joy.
sentences.chinese: 因为你舍弃的东西并没有给你带来半点的欢愉。

sentences.english: Without hesitation, she strapped on a pair of snowshoes and headed out into the snow.
sentences.chinese: 她没有半点迟疑，就绑紧雪鞋走进雪里。

sentences.english: I knew nothing at all of Lady Catherine's connections.
sentences.chinese: 关于咖苔琳夫人的亲戚，我半点儿都不知道。

sentences.english: Even if the intersection into the empty set and should not have the slightest bit of resentment.
sentences.chinese: 即使交集变成了空集也不应该有半点怨恨。

sentences.english: Not carelessness was allowed. No one could assure Qinghe.
sentences.chinese: 此时不可以有半点疏忽。

sentences.english: Going back, it's on the half-hour from the bus-station.
sentences.chinese: 车每半点钟准点从车站往回开。

sentences.english: No dishonesty or conceit whatsoever is permissible in science.
sentences.chinese: 科学来不得半点虚伪和骄傲。

sentences.english: Such a view is not the least bit correct.
sentences.chinese: 这种见解半点也不正确。

sentences.english: But the training here this morning has little to do with war.
sentences.chinese: 但是今天早上的训练和战争没有半点关系。

sentences.english: Said he had no interest in stamps himself.
sentences.chinese: 说他实在没有半点兴趣在邮票上。

sentences.english: He or she cannot vacillate over every tiny decision.
sentences.chinese: 他或她在每个小的决定上不能有半点犹豫。

sentences.english: He is very obedient and always at beck and call, never daring to delay a moment.
sentences.chinese: 他很听话，总是呼之即来，不敢有半点耽搁。

definition: one thread, one hair (idiom); a tiny bit/an iota
the slightest amount or degree/a bit
erhua variant of 一點|一点[yi1 dian3]
not in the least/to completely lack
just the tiniest bit/a hint of
always/at all times/never (if used in negative sentence)
